result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lyndell D. Dale

defendant.name: Dale, Lyndell D.
defendant.address: Portage County Jail, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lyndell D. Dale in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Lyndell D. Dale in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CF-457 and 14CF-315.

1:41 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea.
There is a plea agreement.

13CF-457: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Counts 2-8 will be dismissed and read in.
State requests a PSI and schedule a separate sentencing date. 
11 yrs prison total with conditions to be determined.
14CF-315: To be dismissed and read in.

Atty Sheets concurs. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1 in 13CF-457.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-457 Count 1: 943.32(1a)(2) and 939.05
13CF-457 Counts 2 through 8: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-315: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
Defendant is remanded, to be held without bond.
Plea hearing on January 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lyndell D. Dale in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Lyndell D. Dale in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Eric Sheets in court. Defendant Lyndell D. Dale appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint. Indicates they do expect to waive the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:41 p.m. 
Defendant Lyndell D. Dale appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Eric Sheets in court for Defendant Lyndell D. Dale.
Defendant did not receive copy of complaint.
Court reschedules case.  Bond continued.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with Mitchell Stoltz to the extent that the jail staff can provide that.

Defendant Lyndell D. Dale appeared by video. Attorney Eric Sheets in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has not received a copy of the complaint. 
Court reschedules.

Atty Knaapen recommends a $2,500 signature bond. 
Atty Sheets requests a cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
